results.name: a(n) = A002487(1+A323247(n)) = A324288(A156552(n)).
comment: Like A323902, this also has quite a moderate growth rate, even though a certain subset of terms of A156552 soon grow quite big.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
program: A002487(n) = { my(s=sign(n), a=1, b=0); n = abs(n); while(n>0, if(bitand(n, 1), b+=a, a+=b); n>>=1); (s*b); }; \\ So we use this one, modified from the one given in A002487
A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 20 2019
